page.title: 18 Bury Remembered 2/2
page.content:
During the 1930's many people were unemployed so {Pawn shops}were used a lot. The grandfather of 'John Kenyons' the gents outfitters had a pawn shop on John St.
Up Bell Lane was the{Star picture {house}near St.Paul's Bell School. Pearl White was a star attraction along with Mary Pickford. Cigarettes were 2d(1p) for 5 Woodbines. Chips were 1d(0.4p) and fish at 2d(1p).
We used to travel on steam trains and often used the trams which used to run up Walmersley Rd.
A neighbour, Mrs Holt, aged 93 (b.1892) could remember the days when folk used to get on their hands and knees and scrub the streets and tramlines.
